lexUnit.name: defect.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: abandon one's country or cause in favour of an opposing one.

sentence.text: Ex-major Lorenzo Peres , 37 , tried in vain to persuade the Cuban authorities to let his wife and two children leave after he defected last year .
When Haiducu defected he named , among others , the Romanian Ambassador to France as one of those involved in plots like the one to murder Goma and Tanase .
Emilio Segre was one kid , and Bruno Pontecorvo , later to defect from Britain to the Soviet Union , another .
Clive Anderson defects from Channel 4 to chair the comic panel game Notes And Queries on BBC2 .
He defected from Freud 's psychoanalytic school and insisted that we were mainly motivated by ` strivings for superiority " .
Immediately after defecting from General Motors in March , Mr Lopez demanded deep price cuts from VW 's 1,500 suppliers .
Since 1970 a number of FDP members , critical of domestic and foreign policy , had defected from the government coalition to the CDU .
Mr Athulathmudali had defected from the ruling United National Party in 1991 and led a powerful opposition group , the Democratic United National Front .
Charles E. ( Buddy ) Roemer , the Governor of Louisiana , announced on March 11 that he was defecting from the Democratic to the Republican Party .
Two Nationalist members of Parliament recently defected to Chief Mangosuthu Buthelezi 's Inkatha Freedom Party .
A high-ranking Polish military intelligence officer , Colonel Michael Goleniewski , who had been in charge of Polish military intelligence in East Berlin , defected to the CIA in West Berlin .
The king did not lack military resources , but they were useless if the men who were placed in command of them defected to the enemy .
Late in 1989 , Dirk Coetzee , a scourge of black ANC terrorists , defected to the enemy .
TWELVE Chinese claiming to be fleeing persecution following the Tiananmen Square massacre have arrived by boat on a South Korean island , reportedly seeking to defect to Taiwan .
Viktor Oshchenko , a Russian diplomat in Paris who defected to the West , has refused to see officials from his country 's London embassy .
The trumpeter defected to the West in the mid-Seventies , and clearly found his musical home in the Hard Bop finishing school which was Art Blakey 's Jazz Messengers .
Perhaps Dmitri would find someone younger and more beautiful while on tour abroad , and would defect .
The defectors were not only great dancers , they had an extra quality of independence , a strong artistic character that led them to defect .
